Title: Sean Collier
Content:
Superfast dirt bike rider and local boy, Sean lives in our hometown, Newhall, California. If you have ever had the pleasure of watching him on a motocross course you’ll know what we’re talking about he’s got the flow. He’s on the team.


Q&A

Name
Sean Collier
Nickname
Jeff Iron Montgomery once dubbed me "The Gardener"
Why do you ride?

I'll try and keep this as short as possible.

I ride for a multitude of reasons, first and foremost is I have a deep connection to riding motorcycles. The feeling I get when I go out on the motorcycle and try my best to execute absolute perfection with as much speed as possible is an incredible feeling.

I also have a deep appreciation for a motorcycle that has been properly set up for the advanced rider, the subtle differences add up and give the rider that much more confidence. Razor sharp footpegs being one example.

Where do you ride?
Doesn't matter to me as long as I'm riding
When you're not riding, you are...
Working, climbing, mountain biking, hiking, running, gardening, reading and more
What do you do for a living?
Water Treatment technician specializing in maintaining the integrity of water cooled system's associated with RFGN/ AC.
Who are your heroes?
Anyone who lives their life practicing selflessness, that's heroic to me. Like the king of kings once said, "he who is servant of all is greatest".
Motorcycle
Factory Honda and my dad's '97 KX500
Track
Glen Helen
Races
Day in the Dirt
Moto Memory
Staying with DB for a week riding and training with him and his son. Meeting his family, learning intimate details regarding his motorcycling career, his amazing accomplishment of winning the iron man in Hawaii. And a bunch of other cool stories.
Movie
Gandhi
Stunt
Going on an audition for a climbing commercial and suddenly forgetting how to tie the figure 8 knot. Needless to say I didn't get the job.
MetaDescription: Super fast motocross racer Sean Collier. One of the Fasthouse guys.
MetaKeyword: Sean Collier, motocross, racer, KTM, RedBull, FMF, Fasthouse

Category.Title: Locals
Category.Content:
We are Fasthouse, we represent a lifestyle that is dynamic, energized and full of passion for motorcycles and motorcycle racing – be it motocross, flat track, racing across the desert or simply taking a quick run up Mulholland on a weekend.  We want to introduce you to some of our moto family and friends and invite you to live the life we love.

{{FeaturedArticles}}

More to come!

Title: Ryan Penhall
Content:
A second-generation motorcyclist, Ryan Penhall grew up around two-wheels, as his dad Bruce was once a successful Speedway racer, winning two world championships in 1981 and 1982. 

When he isn’t on his bike, he works at the family business, Conner Concrete Cutting, which was named in honor of his younger brother Conner who passed away three years ago. If you ask Ryan, though, his true passion, and when he feels the most relaxed, is when he’s away from work with his dirt bike beneath him.

Category.Title: Locals
Category.Content:
We are Fasthouse, we represent a lifestyle that is dynamic, energized and full of passion for motorcycles and motorcycle racing – be it motocross, flat track, racing across the desert or simply taking a quick run up Mulholland on a weekend.  We want to introduce you to some of our moto family and friends and invite you to live the life we love.

{{FeaturedArticles}}

More to come!

Title: Mic Rodgers
Content:
Hollywood Stuntman / Director Mic Rodgers has worked on hundreds of films and TV shows. For years he doubled Mel Gibson, he’s been there, done it. He loves his job, but his passion is moto. Most weekends you can find him at a local motorcycle race. This love affair with dirt bikes goes way back, to places like Carlsbad and Saddleback. He did most of his time with CMC and he has competed in EVERY Day in the Dirt Motocross Grand Prix. We love his no bullshit attitude, he’s one of ours.


Q&A

Name
Mic Rodgers
Nickname
Micker, 115
Why do you ride?
I love motorcycles... my first bike was a Taco scooter, i was 6. at 13 i got a H-D 250 Sprint and rode it to school every day... all the way through High School ! i started racing MX in 71, and have not stopped...Motocross is my sport . it's my passion!
Where do you ride?
I always race "A Day in the Dirt", I'v got 18 yrs at Mammoth, REM every Saturday. i got time at every track in the SO CAL
When you're not riding, you are...
Surf Longboards at C street, shoot a lot of guns..45 auto,AR's and long range 308's
What do you do for a living?
I've been a Stuntman in the picture business for over 40 yrs. For the last 20 yrs or so I have been a 2nd Unit Director/Stunt-Coordintator
Who are your heroes?
Steve McQueen and Bud Ekins , both where great racers, fun guys to be around
Motorcycle
My 62' BSA Goldstar built by Dick Mann! and any MX bike
Track
Mammoth, LACR, REM
Races
"A Day in the Dirt" , Mammoth and any Saturday race at REM
Moto Memory
Hole shooted the +60 EXP at the 013 World Vet. all the love and support i got after i broke every bone in my body at Lemon Grove in 98'
Movie
Being Mel Gibson's Stunt Dbl in Bravehart and all the Lethal Weapon movies
Stunt
I've been on fire, gone fast, crashed cars..100ft high falls...battles with 2000 guys in Bravehart...it's just like the Fall Guy song...and i love being the unknow stuntman
MetaDescription: Meet Hollywood Stuntman & Director Mic Rodgers. One of the Fasthouse crew.
MetaKeyword: Mic Rodgers, Brand X, stuntman, stunt coordinator, 2nd Unit Director, Mel Gibson, Braveheart, motorcycle racer, motocross, Day in the Dirt, Saddleback

{{FeaturedArticles}}

More to come!

Title: Riley Harper
Content:
Riley Harper is living the dream. He is following his father’s footsteps (Tom Harper) not only in the film industry but also in his love of motorcycles. Riley works around the world as a stuntman, lives in So Cal, rides with his buddies at the local moto tracks, and you can find him most weekends tearing down Mulholland on his Triumph.


Q&A

Name
Riley Harper
Why do you ride?
Because it feeds my soul. Nothing compares.
Where do you ride?
I ride motocross at all the tracks in So-cal. I also ride my street legal bikes through the canyons of the Santa Monica Mountains where I live and all up the coast.
When you're not riding, you are...
Thinking about riding, Building old Bikes, working on bikes, Surfing, Camping, Working, Hiking with my dogs, playing music with my friends, being with my family.
What do you do for a living?
Started working as a stuntman at the age of 7 and have been doing it ever since.
Who are your heroes?
My dad Tom Harper, he taught me all i know and continues to teach me daily. Steve Mcqueen for pure style, and really anyone that inspires me on a daily basis.
Motorcycle
Triumph for street, Honda for Dirt.
Track
Lemon Grove, the old school Piru.
Races
A Day in the Dirt
Moto Memory
Racing Day in the Dirt and bring in the same races as so many legends like JN Roberts, Ricky Johnson, Jeff Ward, Jeremy Mcgrath. so Rad.
Movie
On Any Sunday, Endless Summer, Point Break, Step Brothers.
Stunt
Jumping a 450 Honda off of a double decker car transporter up a freeway overpass 60 feet dressed in the Batman Suit for "Dark Knight Rises"
MetaDescription: Meet Riley Harper. Hollywood stuntman & motorcycle racer.
MetaKeyword: Riley Harper, stuntman, Brand X,  Hollywood, motorcycle racer, Tom Harper,  Captain America

Category.Title: Locals
Category.Content:
We are Fasthouse, we represent a lifestyle that is dynamic, energized and full of passion for motorcycles and motorcycle racing – be it motocross, flat track, racing across the desert or simply taking a quick run up Mulholland on a weekend.  We want to introduce you to some of our moto family and friends and invite you to live the life we love.

{{FeaturedArticles}}

More to come!

Title: Ricky Diaz
Content:
The first time we met Ricky, of course, was at a local track – Milestone. We loved his style and we got to know him pretty well that day. He’s been one of us ever since, a So Cal local. The kid can throw it down.

Q&A

Name
Ricky Diaz
Nickname
RD, Diaz
Why do you ride?
Dirt bikes lit a fire in me at an early age. I feed off of the adrenaline. Being able to overcome the fear that comes with dirt bikes at times; I live for that.
Where do you ride?
I'm a weekend warrior nowadays. I can usually be found at one of the major So-Cal tracks if I'm on my dirt bike, or in the Canyons of South Orange County if I'm riding my cafe. And of course, the hills after a good downpour.
When you're not riding, you are...
Working, spinning wrenches, riding my cafe racer through the canyons, and/or enjoying ice cold brews with my woman and best buds.
What do you do for a living?
I work for a company called Advanced Marine Power in Newport Beach as a Marine Diesel Technician.
Who are your heroes?
My mom and dad, for sure. They formed the morals that made me who I am today. Also, my boss, second dad, and good friend Greg Fountain. He's an animal on a dirt bike in Mexico, and no one works harder through a 12 hour work day than he does.
Motorcycle
My YZ250F race bike in 2009. Honda CB550/750. Those in-line 4 cylinder engines are so rad.
Track
Zaca Station, Racetown. Will someone Re-open Racetown please?
Races
SRA gp's and REM at Glen Helen when I was younger. Day in the Dirt, Mammoth.
Moto Memory
In 2003 I was riding my YZ85 on the main track at Lake Elsinore when I heard a much faster rider on a four stroke come up behind me before a good sized table top. I hit the jump and looked over to find Chad Reed sitting sideways looking at me with a thumbs up. I was just short of wading up from being so stoked on what happened. He was my all time favorite rider growing up.
Movie
Step Brothers
Stunt
That's tough. Up until a couple months ago I would say a clean turndown on my dirt bike hands down. However, I've been hooked on surfing my cafe racer recently.

Category.Title: Locals
Category.Content:
We are Fasthouse, we represent a lifestyle that is dynamic, energized and full of passion for motorcycles and motorcycle racing – be it motocross, flat track, racing across the desert or simply taking a quick run up Mulholland on a weekend.  We want to introduce you to some of our moto family and friends and invite you to live the life we love.

{{FeaturedArticles}}

More to come!

Title: R.J. Wageman
Content:
R.J. was born into the moto family. You can find R.J. most weekends riding and roosting on his buddies at Piru MX located on Highway 126 just down the road from what used to be dirt bike heaven, the Legendary Indian Dunes. His dad, Russ, back in the day was a super fast local pro who did most of his time at the Dunes. R.J.’s roots run deep.


Q&A

Name
RJ Wageman
Nickname
Lil Rusty
Why do you ride?
Motocross is my love, and it's my life. It puts a smile on my face every chance I get to go ride. It's a great way to get some exercise and stay in great shape to live a healthy life. Making memories that will last a lifetime, talking and laughing with your "moto" buddies. And of course that one feeling few people get to experience, WINNING!
Where do you ride?
Living in the hub of all motocross tracks, my options are endless throughout the week! Glen Helen, Competitive Edge, Cauhilla Creek, Pala, Milestone, Racetown395, Zaca Station, I5, Piru, Perris, and Lucas Oil Mx Park. I've also been to Loretta Lynn's, Freestone, Mammoth, Hangtown, and Ponca City.
When you're not riding, you are...
When I'm not riding, you will find me riding or racing my mountain bike! I'm in love with exercising and can't get enough cardio.
What do you do for a living?
My dad, Russ, owns a motorcycle service, repair, and accessories shop called Pit Pro. I help him out there 2-3 times a week to keep busy and also make a little lunch money.
Who are your heroes?
I look up to my dad, he's been there done that and knows what it takes to get the job done. I look up to all professional athletes, it takes a lot to get to the top level and I know it's not easy. I've been a Travis Pastrana fan for as long as I can remember. All around a bad dude!
Motorcycle
My Dirt Bike Magazine, Pit Pro powered Yamaha YZ 250f
Track
Zaca Station MX
Races
Loretta Lynn's amateur national in Hurricane Mills, Tennessee. If you want to get your name on the map, that's the place to get it done!
Moto Memory
Winning two motos at the World Mini Grand Prix. Placing 4th in one moto at Loretta Lynn's and finishing 4th overall.
Movie
Ride Along! With Kevin Hart and Ice Cube, they will rock your world, it's a must see.
Stunt
A super big, clean, fat whip! Nothing cooler looking, or better feeling on the bike when you throw her sideways.
MetaDescription: Super fast motocross racer R.J. Wageman. One of the Fasthouse guys.
MetaKeyword: RJ Wageman, R.J. Wageman, motocross racer, Fasthouse

We are Fasthouse, we represent a lifestyle that is dynamic, energized and full of passion for motorcycles and motorcycle racing – be it motocross, flat track, racing across the desert or simply taking a quick run up Mulholland on a weekend.  We want to introduce you to some of our moto family and friends and invite you to live the life we love.

{{FeaturedArticles}}

More to come!

Title: Terry Cook
Content:
Terry Cook tells it like it is, he pushes the limits, and has that moto attitude. It serves him well, whether he’s racing his dirt bike or his mountain bike. This attitude we love so much is one of calm confidence and a belief in excellence, that’s Terry Cook personified.

Q&A

Name
Terry Cook
Nickname
TC, Cookie
Why do you ride?
I ride because #1, it's really fun. And #2, when you are out on the track or in the dez, or wherever the spot is that day, the real world doesn't matter anymore. It's just you, the bike and your buds.
Where do you ride?
Mainly local So-Cal tracks. Every once in a great while I'll hit the dez, but its gotta be prime, just after a good rain. I hate the dust.
When you're not riding, you are...
Spending time with my beautiful and supportive wife and 2 kids. Riding and racing my bicycles.
What do you do for a living?
I'm a high-end custom residential framing contractor.
Who are your heroes?
Wow...that's a tough question for me. I never really had any heroes growing up. I'd have to say that I admire the people that can continually balance the act of being successful in all areas of their lives (professionally, mentally, spiritually, etc.). It's something that I strive to do, and it's not easy!
Motorcycle
I'll ride anything with 2 wheels...Although I've been getting into the vintage thing lately.
Track
Zaca Station MX
Races
Any race that my son Caleb is in, is my favorite.
Moto Memory
I have a few bad ones that I'd like to forget...
Movie
I fall asleep during just about every movie I watch.
MetaDescription: Terry Cook pushes the limits of the motocross attitude.
MetaKeyword: Terry Cook, motocross racer, Troy Lee Designs, Fasthouse, One Industries, Mountain Bike Racer

Category.Title: Locals
Category.Content:
We are Fasthouse, we represent a lifestyle that is dynamic, energized and full of passion for motorcycles and motorcycle racing – be it motocross, flat track, racing across the desert or simply taking a quick run up Mulholland on a weekend.  We want to introduce you to some of our moto family and friends and invite you to live the life we love.

{{FeaturedArticles}}

More to come!

Title: Willy Simons Jr.
Content:
Willy Jr. was born with moto DNA in his blood, handed down from his dad Willy Simons Sr. He calls Simi Valley his home, but he mostly lives in the dirt of So Cal's many motocross venues. Keep an eye on this kid, he's one of our moto crew.

Q&A

Name
Willy Simons Jr.
Nickname
Wilbur
Why do you ride?
I ride because there's no better feeling to me than being able to flow on a motorcycle and getting adrenaline rushes, nothing else has ever gave me that feeling before.
Where do you ride?
SoCal! Glen Helen, Piru, Milestone
When you're not riding, you are...
When I'm not riding, I'm most likely in the garage working on the bikes or riding my mountain bike
What do you do for a living?
School and Moto
Who are your heroes?
My hero is most definitely my dad, Willy Simons he's gone through the ranks traveled the world racing and has done just about everything you can do on a dirt bike. He's 54 years old still shredding and causing trouble at the track.
Motorcycle
My Simi Valley Cycles-powered YZ250F!
Track
Glen Helen
Races
Mammoth, Day in the Dirt, Amateur Nationals
Moto Memory
My best moto memory aside from racing was all the times I got to ride with Kurt Caselli, I was able to know Kurt my whole life and learned a bunch from him, looking back on it now it was pretty special.
Movie
Lone survivor
Stunt
I only have whips under my belt haha.

Category.Title: Locals
Category.Content:
We are Fasthouse, we represent a lifestyle that is dynamic, energized and full of passion for motorcycles and motorcycle racing – be it motocross, flat track, racing across the desert or simply taking a quick run up Mulholland on a weekend.  We want to introduce you to some of our moto family and friends and invite you to live the life we love.

{{FeaturedArticles}}

More to come!

Title: Bob Tocco
Content:
If you’ve be around the moto scene during the past 45 years you probably have run into Bob. He is one of the most colorful characters we have the privilege to hang out with. Moto has been his life from racing as a kid in So Cal, a Saddleback local, to today where you can find him at all the cool races. He always has a smile on his face and he definitely knows how to have a good time. We love his style.



Q&A

Name
Bobby Tocco
Nickname
Bobalooch
Why do you ride?
Well started as a Kid and it has been the strong point of life for me..Great Life long friendships and tons of great memories. Heck love it just as much as I did the 1st. day I threw a leg over a Taco minibike...
Where do you ride?
Right out of my Garage!!!!,Hahah.Do all types of racing still. Flat Track, TT, Moto, G.P. hell I even throw a leg over a speedway bike now & then,,(Rode for Bruce Penhall when I was younger). Started a 150cc class for all us old guy's and it's starting to grow!!!.Come on out and give it a go!
When you're not riding, you are...
Buildin more bikes!! I have a few of them...150?
What do you do for a living?
Plumber for the Los Angeles Dept. of Water & Power
Who are your heroes?
Marty Smith, Kenny Roberts, Gary Nixon, (Rest In Peace Pal) just to name a few..One very special one we Just lost and a very good friend.. Miss him dearly,(He grew up racin with my Son) KC66...Rest In Peace Son...
Motorcycle
Honda's(more than one!)
Track
Glen Helen(REM Track)
Races
All types of racing...
Moto Memory
Winning my 1972 Minicycle cChampionship and the first person to sit me down and ask me what i would do next, Steve McQueen (his daughter Teri was my girlfriend at the time). I thought i did it all. He said, "It's just the beginning Son".
Movie
Great Escape, On Any Sunday, Bullit
Stunt
Not into crazy flips, just dig to get my moto on!!!
MetaDescription: If youve be around the moto scene during the past 45 years you probably have run into Bob Tocco.
MetaKeyword: Bob Tocco, motorcycle collector, motorcycle racer, Fasthose crew, Saddleback

{{FeaturedArticles}}

More to come!

Title: Billy "Jetboat" Hammon
Content: Billy Hammon, aka Jetboat, is one of our good friends, not only to the Fasthouse crew but to stunt folks world wide. He has a shop in Chatsworth where he spends endless hours getting cars ready for Hollywood stuntmen and a few daredevils. He’s a moto lover like the rest of us. He’s got a very big heart.

Category.Title: Locals
Category.Content:
We are Fasthouse, we represent a lifestyle that is dynamic, energized and full of passion for motorcycles and motorcycle racing – be it motocross, flat track, racing across the desert or simply taking a quick run up Mulholland on a weekend.  We want to introduce you to some of our moto family and friends and invite you to live the life we love.

{{FeaturedArticles}}

More to come!

Title: Scott Burnworth
Content:
The California vintage racing scene has such a cool vibe going these days thanks in part to Scott Burnworth aka Burner. If you show up at one of these events you can’t miss Scott, he’s promoting, racing, or maybe both with his unique style and color. A man after our own heart.

Q&A

Name
Scott Burnworth
Nickname
The Burner
Why do you ride?
Because I love it!… I started when I was 9 years old and never looked back!
Where do you ride?
Vogt Ranch, Cahuilla, Pala, Glen Helen, The Ranch, Chaney Ranch
When you're not riding, you are...
Hanging with my family and friends. We like to go to the desert, the river and downtown San Diego.
What do you do for a living?
Graphic Designer
Who are your heroes?
My mom and dad all the old school MX Legends.
Motorcycle
OSSA
Track
Vogt Ranch
Races
So Cal Vintage MX Classic, Day in the Dirt, Calvmx Vintage Races
Moto Memory
Getting my first factory ride in 1981 with Yamaha alongside my heroes: Bob Hannah, Broc Glover and Mike Bell
Movie
Caddyshack
Stunt
I don't do stunts, I'm too old! The only stunts I do are by accident.
MetaDescription: Meet Scott Burnworth. One of the faster guys.
MetaKeyword: Scott Burnworth, The Burner, motocross racer, Fasthouse

Category.Title: Locals
Category.Content:
We are Fasthouse, we represent a lifestyle that is dynamic, energized and full of passion for motorcycles and motorcycle racing – be it motocross, flat track, racing across the desert or simply taking a quick run up Mulholland on a weekend.  We want to introduce you to some of our moto family and friends and invite you to live the life we love.

{{FeaturedArticles}}

More to come!

Title: Jason McCune
Content:
Jason McCune, part of our crew, resides in our hometown. And if you’re in the moto industry you know him, he’s one of the main guys at Leatt. He lives and breathes the moto lifestyle we love. You can usually find Jason at all the big races or throwing it down in Baja.


Q&A

Name
Jason McCune
Nickname
Hapa
Why do you ride?
I ride because of the places it can take me and the freedom that it brings. Nothing like riding motocross with your buddies or riding a wheelie down a beach in Baja!
Where do you ride?
I ride anywhere from the local moto tracks in socal all the way down to the peninsula of Baja!
When you're not riding, you are...
I'm spending time with the family and riding my mountain bike. Andrea, Gavin, Tori, and Darin are my world. They all make it possible for me TO ride. They have always supported my sports and in turn Moto itself has brought us all closer together!
What do you do for a living?
I'm blessed with what I get to do. Moto is a passion and I'm fortunate enough to be able to work in the industry as the Brand Manager for Leatt. What's that mean? I get to do a lot of cool things with a lot of cool people.
Who are your heroes?
My Dad for sure. Like many others....he's the one that got me into to riding dirt bikes! Dirt Bikes are a big part of why family is so important.
Motorcycle
My '71 CT 70. My 2008 Honda CRF 450 (I shoulda never sold that bike). My 2012 CRF 450X.....my Baja Warrior
Track
LACR......bring it back!!!!!!!!
Races
Mammoth and A Day in the Dirt for sure! Family and Friends all week and the best of the best (both now and then) lining up at the gate! Doesn't get much better!
Moto Memory
Winning Mammoth with my family and friends there to help celebrate! Finishing 2nd at Mammoth and having my Dad there to cheer me on! Rolling into Cabo after 1600 miles of riding the Baja Peninsula and seeing my wife and my daughter waiting for me!
Movie
On Any Sunday, The Hangover
Stunt
I can wheelie.....kinda
MetaDescription: Fasthouse is proud to support Jason McCune and Leatt Brace
MetaKeyword: Jason McCune, Leatt, Fasthouse

Category.Title: Locals
Category.Content:
We are Fasthouse, we represent a lifestyle that is dynamic, energized and full of passion for motorcycles and motorcycle racing – be it motocross, flat track, racing across the desert or simply taking a quick run up Mulholland on a weekend.  We want to introduce you to some of our moto family and friends and invite you to live the life we love.

{{FeaturedArticles}}

More to come!

Title: Richard McCormick
Content:
McCormick aka Ironman has been working behind the cameras in the movie business for years. His passion is our passion – motorcycles. Back in the day he was a regular at Indian Dunes and he’s still pinning it today. We love it.


Q&A

Name
Richard McCormick
Nickname
IRONMAN
Why do you ride?
It's part of my life, I ride to keep my mind and reactions sharp, and i am always happy when i can ride every day.
Where do you ride?
I am very lucky that i can ride from my home on my dirt bike's in the hills behind me, and in the canyons on my street bikes.
When you're not riding, you are...
Hanging out with my wife and daughter, Racing Sprint cars & Midgets, Cycling (Road & Mountain), In the Gym, Working on all my toys.
What do you do for a living?
GRIP, DP, Camera Op, Design Camera Mounts.
Who are your heroes?
J.N.Roberts, A.J. Foyt, Kenny Roberts and the list goes on.
Motorcycle
CZ
Track
Indian Dunes & Ascot Park
Races
A Day in the Dirt
Moto Memory
Racing on friday nights at Indian Dunes, and Super Moto
Movie
On Any Sunday
Stunt
Rigging cameras on everything
MetaDescription: The Ironman has been working behind the cameras in the movie business for years.
MetaKeyword: Richard McCormick, motorcycle racer, Hollywood crew, filmmaker, Ironman

Category.Title: Locals
Category.Content:
We are Fasthouse, we represent a lifestyle that is dynamic, energized and full of passion for motorcycles and motorcycle racing – be it motocross, flat track, racing across the desert or simply taking a quick run up Mulholland on a weekend.  We want to introduce you to some of our moto family and friends and invite you to live the life we love.

{{FeaturedArticles}}

More to come!

Title: Mel Stoutsenberger
Content:
In the early days of BMX racing, and the glory days of 70's motocross, Mel was one of those guys out there with his camera, getting pelted by dirt and rocks, documenting history. His photos are classics. 


Q&A

Name
Mel Stoutsenberger
Nickname
Un-Stouss
Why do you ride?
It’s that feeling of freedom I get from being in full control of the two wheels beneath me. It feels good to my body and it does wonders for my mind. No other sport compares.
Where do you ride?
I'll ride anywhere. Tracks, the desert, the mountains, at the beach.
When you're not riding, you are...
Shooting photos, mountain-biking, hiking, surfing or remodeling my house.
What do you do for a living?
I'm a construction superintendent and I own a photography business.
Who are your heroes?
That's a tough one. There has been so many great riders both local and over-seas in all facets of this sport that it's tough to choose.
Motorcycle
XR500R and KTM500
Track
All of them.
Races
I haven't been to a race I didn't enjoy.
Movie
The Good, the Bad and the Ugly.
Moto Memory
Riding in the snow covered trials of the Tehachapi mountains with my best friends Mark Kiel and Butch Baum.

Category.Title: Locals
Category.Content:
We are Fasthouse, we represent a lifestyle that is dynamic, energized and full of passion for motorcycles and motorcycle racing – be it motocross, flat track, racing across the desert or simply taking a quick run up Mulholland on a weekend.  We want to introduce you to some of our moto family and friends and invite you to live the life we love.

{{FeaturedArticles}}

More to come!

Title: Tom Harper
Content:
Motorcycle racer / Hollywood stuntman, Tom Harper, works on some of the biggest action flicks in the biz. But his first love is dirt bikes. You can say he was born into it, spending most of his youth riding, racing, and creating lifelong friendships at his local moto park, Indian Dunes. Dirt bikes have influenced absolutely everything in his life, from his work to bringing up his boys. It’s the lifestyle, he’s a member of our moto family.

Q&A

Name
Tom Harper
Nickname
Flying H
Why do you ride?
Once it gets in your blood it's there forever.
Where do you ride?
Glen Helen, AV,Mile tone, Gorman.
When you're not riding, you are...
Flying my radio control gliders, Surfing, Riding my horse, Racing my sprint car.
What do you do for a living?
Stuntman/Stunt Coordinator/2nd unit Director
Who are your heroes?
Steve McQueen, Joel Robert, My brother Will Harper, My wife and all of my kids.
Motorcycle
My 1970 Track Master 500cc Triumph.
Track
Indian Dunes
Races
A Day in the Dirt
Moto Memory
Racing the 1974 Super Bowl of Motocross
Movie
The Lone Ranger
Stunt
Jumping a car out of the park ave. tunnel in New York City 128'
MetaDescription: Meet motorcycle racer and Hollywood stuntman, Tom Harper. One of the Fasthouse crew.
MetaKeyword: Tom Harper, Fasthouse, Brand X, stuntman, motorcycle racer

Category.Title: Locals
Category.Content:
We are Fasthouse, we represent a lifestyle that is dynamic, energized and full of passion for motorcycles and motorcycle racing – be it motocross, flat track, racing across the desert or simply taking a quick run up Mulholland on a weekend.  We want to introduce you to some of our moto family and friends and invite you to live the life we love.

{{FeaturedArticles}}

More to come!

Title: Brian Palmer
Content:
We’ve known Brian for years, he’s the realtor to most of the motoheads we know. And he’s been a fixture at the dirt bike race we put on called Day in the Dirt. He always has something smart to say, makes us love his style and his sense of humor. Brian and Tami are our kind of people.


Q&A

Name
Brian Palmer
Nickname
BP
Why do you ride?
Because when your on your bike, all of life's noise is gone. You forget about everything else and just feel the flow of the machine. Whether its jumping at a track, blowing up a berm, or chasing your buddy up a sand wash, you just cant keep the smile off your face.
Where do you ride?
Nowadays, mostly offroad. Right from my house in Agua Dulce and other "can't mention" areas in the high desert. Still love to hit Milestone once in a while.
When you're not riding, you are...
Thinking about riding...and praying for rain!
What do you do for a living?
Realtor
Who are your heroes?
My wife, who always has a smile and sees the good in everyone and every day.
Motorcycle
1979 YZ 400
Track
LACR, Milestone
Races
DITD, Big 6 GP, WORCS
Moto Memory

Winning Havasu Worcs Race without a clue what place I was in until crossing the finish line.

Getting cleaned out @ LACR DITD before the water hole jump by some pro, went from pissed to stoked when my wife told me it was MC.

Movie
Dumb & Dumber, Joe Dirt, and Ricky Bobby
Stunt
Trail Bull Dozer & Professional Goon Rider

Category.Title: Locals
Category.Content:
We are Fasthouse, we represent a lifestyle that is dynamic, energized and full of passion for motorcycles and motorcycle racing – be it motocross, flat track, racing across the desert or simply taking a quick run up Mulholland on a weekend.  We want to introduce you to some of our moto family and friends and invite you to live the life we love.

{{FeaturedArticles}}

More to come!

Title: Clay Cullen
Content:
One of Hollywood’s top stuntmen. Clay was a Pro Jet Skier, and is a lover of dirt bikes , street bikes and badass cars. He turned his passion for speed into a very successful profession. When he’s not working on a summer blockbuster you can find him at his compound where he has a rally car course and a sweet motocross track. We love his style.


Q&A

Name
Clay Cullen
Nickname
Clayster, back in the jet ski days ...
Why do you ride?
The natural buzz you get from riding is my drug ! The connectivity of effort with adrenaline wile motoing makes me feel alive and keeps rewarding me with satisfaction !
Where do you ride?
My house, Wyveren, local tracks in North Los Angeles County, or anything that looks like a single track trail locally or in the desert
When you're not riding, you are...
Working hopefully ... To buy gas! Nah...I'm with my wife Molly and son Sonny and friends mostly at the beach with a stand up ski or a paddle board ...Occasional track days in my car or on sport bike too
What do you do for a living?
Slip on banana peals, crash cars, fake fight, and get blown up.... Lol - but pretty much true Aka(stuntman)
Who are you heroes?
Doug Henry, MC, JW, RC, TP, Valentino Rossi, Rick Roy
Motorcycle
The '14 YZF 450 = Such a Great motor... My 88 CR500 = Best sound & my old 09 YZF450... silky smooth and stable
Track
Mammoth , or any if my buds are out there
Races
Any Day in the Dirt at L.A.C.R ... They were bitchen'
Moto Memory
Winning Mammoth in '88 125 amateur and every lap getting B A'd by the boys. Getting a 4th one year in the Coup de Grace at Day in the Dirt (2000. Think Mike Brown won it that year. I felt I held the torch high for a working stuntman back then
Movie
Fast Times at Ridgemont High / Mad Max / Star Wars
Stunt
Generally most bike stuff is "no helmet", so that always kinda blows but any that have a roll cage or a button are awesome!
MetaDescription: Meet one of Hollywoods top stuntmen, Clay Cullen. One of the Fasthouse Crew.
MetaKeyword: Clay Cullen, Fasthouse, Jet Ski, World Champion, Brand X, stuntman, motorcycle racer

Category.Title: Locals
Category.Content:
We are Fasthouse, we represent a lifestyle that is dynamic, energized and full of passion for motorcycles and motorcycle racing – be it motocross, flat track, racing across the desert or simply taking a quick run up Mulholland on a weekend.  We want to introduce you to some of our moto family and friends and invite you to live the life we love.

{{FeaturedArticles}}

More to come!

Title: Gary Guercio
Content:
Surfer, dirt bike rider, mountain biker, and stuntman, Gary Guercio, is one of our go to guys. From the very beginning he's been a member of our moto family, helping us with our annual get together called A Day in the Dirt. And we love his work.


Q&A

Name
Gary Guercio
Why do you ride?
It's fun, a great release & exercise. Riding really helps with your timing for stunt work. Also, the lifelong friendships made & camaraderie riding, racing with friends is priceless. Creates impressionable memories & stories for years to come.
Where do you ride?
Gorman, Glen Helen, & other tracks occasionally. Love to hit the trails & desert after the rains.It's a plus to be able to ride out my house after the rains, gets the adrenaline flowing.
When you're not riding, you are...
Hanging with the family, Surfing & Mountain Biking, & of course always looking for the next Stunt gig.
What do you do for a living?
Stuntman, Stunt Coordinator.
Who are your heroes?
My Family. In Sports: Jeremy McGrath "King of Supercross", Kelly Slater, phenomenal athlete & 11 time World Champion still going strong! Warren Buffett, follow his lead & you'll be pleasantly surprised.
Motorcycle
'Honda's & KTM's
Track
LACR back in the Day. Pala, Glen Helen, Gorman.
Races
A Day in the Dirt, LACR GP's, & Mammoth
Moto Memory
Getting passed by McGrath at A Day in the Dirt, the roost never felt so good.
Movie
A River Runs Through It, Legends of the Fall, The Godfather, too many to list...
Stunt
Anything with Motorcycles & Cars.
MetaDescription: Meet Gary Guercio, motocross racer and stuntman
MetaKeyword: Gary Guercio, motocross, stuntman

Category.Title: Locals
Category.Content:
We are Fasthouse, we represent a lifestyle that is dynamic, energized and full of passion for motorcycles and motorcycle racing – be it motocross, flat track, racing across the desert or simply taking a quick run up Mulholland on a weekend.  We want to introduce you to some of our moto family and friends and invite you to live the life we love.

{{FeaturedArticles}}

More to come!

Title: John Simanovich
Content:
John has been part of the crew for as long as we can remember. He has been riding dirt bikes forever. He works for Transworld Motocross and helps organize and put on the best So Cal Series. He announces at our Over the Hump LA mountain bike races. He’s got a way with words. One of our brothers.



Q&A

Name
John Simanovich
Nickname
The Voice
Why do you ride?
I ride for the excitement, love, and passion of motorcycles that I shared with my Dad.
Where do you ride?
Where is there not a good place to ride? Anytime you can be with your buddies, from riding at a local SoCal track or in the hills, is always great.
When you're not riding, you are...
If you don’t find me at the track riding or bantering with buddies on my tailgate, you can often find me with a microphone in hand announcing the Muscle Milk TWMX Race Series or a number of two-wheeled events, like the LA County Over Hump Mountain Bike events. And of course I can’t forget about spending time with the family!
What do you do for a living?
Monday through Friday (or often seven day a week), I am an advertising representative for TransWorld Motocross, the number one motocross media company in the world. In addition to my sales grind, I help operate the Muscle Milk TWMX Race Series, which had quickly become the largest amateur racing organization in Southern California, and over the past three years I’ve been fortunate enough to turn my skills on a microphone into a gig as an announcer.
Who are your heroes?
Easy enough, my Dad…
Motorcycle
Yamaha YZ450F
Track
I love them all in their own special way.
Races
TransWorld Motocross Industry Cup and of course the famed A Day in the Dirt.
Moto Memory
My first memorable moment was the first day I laid eyes on my Yamaha PW50 at the young age of 3, while my second was qualifying for Loretta Lynn’s in the +25 class in 2009. Sure, my results in Tennessee weren’t great, but managed to win the regional qualifier.
Movie
RAD
Stunt
The Triple Lindy

Category.Title: Locals
Category.Content:
We are Fasthouse, we represent a lifestyle that is dynamic, energized and full of passion for motorcycles and motorcycle racing – be it motocross, flat track, racing across the desert or simply taking a quick run up Mulholland on a weekend.  We want to introduce you to some of our moto family and friends and invite you to live the life we love.

{{FeaturedArticles}}

More to come!

Title: Fast Family
Content:
The Hoefts, are one fast family. Dad Darrin owns a pool company, but that’s not what his life is about. What runs through his veins is the love of motorcycles, riding and racing, he’s one of the fastest Vets around, His sons are proof that you are born into it, Justin races for Troy Lee Designs, he flat out hauls ass. And his younger brother Tyler was following in his footsteps.
April 1st, 2015 was bittersweet, as the motocross community gathered at Glen Helen in memory of Tyler Clay Hoeft. The Fasthouse crew was there to ride, remember and celebrate his life. Tyler was a precocious 14 year-old who left us much too young after succumbing to injuries sustained in a crash in Freestone, Texas. He grew up on two wheels, riding around his hometown of Castaic Lake, and blossomed into a fast, determined and dedicated racer. To his friends and family, Tyler was kind, gentle, and loyal. On the track he was an intense competitor who loved racing motocross. Those lucky enough to witness him ride saw a talent few possess: an effortless and fluid style that was poetry in motion.
Tyler’s memorial service went exactly how he would have liked it. Following a touching devotional, everyone in attendance joined the family on the track for a parade lap, Tyler's dad Darrin, mom Michelle, brother Justin, and Justin’s girlfriend Kaelyn led the procession around the track where Tyler had spun countless laps throughout his life. Afterwards, the track was open for riding, allowing everyone to spin laps in memory of Tyler. It’s often difficult to understand why tragedies like this happen, however, in his short time with us, Tyler touched a lot of lives, and lived more in 14 years than most do in a lifetime. It was a day filled with sadness, but it was also a day filled with laughter, memories, and good times—exactly how Tyler would have wanted it to be. It was truly a celebration of Tyler’s life. He will never be forgotten.
MetaDescription: The Hoefts are one fast motocross family.
MetaKeyword: Hoeft, Justin, Motocross, MX, motorcycle racing family, Fasthouse
BrowserTitle: Fasthouse | Locals & Legends | The Hoeft Family

Category.Title: Locals
Category.Content:
We are Fasthouse, we represent a lifestyle that is dynamic, energized and full of passion for motorcycles and motorcycle racing – be it motocross, flat track, racing across the desert or simply taking a quick run up Mulholland on a weekend.  We want to introduce you to some of our moto family and friends and invite you to live the life we love.

{{FeaturedArticles}}

More to come!

Title: Reid Harper
Content:
The Harper DNA is loaded with dirt bike and racing genes, and Reid’s got his share.  His love of motorcycles has taken him down the coast of Baja and to all the local So Cal motocross tracks.  Reid has also joined the Harper family business, stunts.  And the cool thing is, he’s part of our moto crew.


Q&A

Name
Reid Harper
Nickname
Speedy Reidy
Why do you ride?
That's a tough question, for me whenever i ride it just gets rid of my worries and I love doing it
Where do you ride?
All over the place.. Piru, AV, Milestone, Glen Helen, Pala, Zaca, and the Mojave Desert
When you're not riding, you are...
Surfing, working in the garage, Skateboarding and working
What do you do for a living?
I'm a Stuntman in the Movie Industry
Who are your heroes?
That would have to be my Dad, he's taught me everything I know about motorcycles and how to be a good person
Motorcycle
Don't have one in particular.
Track
LACR
Races
A Day in the Dirt GP
Moto Memory
Riding 1200 miles in Mexico
Movie
On Any Sunday
Stunt
Too many
MetaDescription: Meet Reid Harper. Motocross racer, stuntman, and super cool guy,
MetaKeyword: Reid Harper, motocross racer, stuntman, hollywood, Fasthouse

Category.Title: Locals
Category.Content:
We are Fasthouse, we represent a lifestyle that is dynamic, energized and full of passion for motorcycles and motorcycle racing – be it motocross, flat track, racing across the desert or simply taking a quick run up Mulholland on a weekend.  We want to introduce you to some of our moto family and friends and invite you to live the life we love.

{{FeaturedArticles}}

More to come!

Title: Lance Coury
Content:
We love this guy. He’s one of the coolest. He lives in So Cal and his passion is motorcycles. He rides them well. He’s been doing it since the age of 4, as we like to say “once it gets in your blood it stays with you forever.” He’s got the style.


Q&A

Name
Lance Coury
Nickname
Courky
Why do you ride?
I ride cause I enjoy the state of mind your in while doing it. It is an amazing getaway from stress. Whether I am on my dirtbikes, street bikes, riding solo, or with buddies it is enjoyable.
Where do you ride?
I ride around the world, home base is Southern California, but I have ridden all over Europe, Egypt, Dubai, South America, New Zealand, South Korea, and of course the United States.
When you're not riding, you are...
Hanging with my family or buddies and talking about the last ride and the next ride.
What do you do for a living?
Ride motorcycles!!!
Who are your heroes?
My parents! I am stoked on the way the raised me and the opportunities they gave me.
Motorcycle
Moto: Suzuki RMZ 450 | Street: Harley Davidson Dyna
Track
Zaca Station
Races
A Day in the Dirt
Moto Memory
Winning X Games Gold in Brazil
Movie
All funny movies, like Step Brothers!
Stunt
A stunt I have done? Moto the streets of South Korea on a Bob Brown Film. A stunt I have seen was when Bob Brown jumped out of a huge building on fire. Haha
MetaDescription: Lance Coury lives in So Cal and his passion is motorcycles. He rides them well. Hes got the style.
MetaKeyword: Lance Coury, FMX, freestyle motocross, X-Games, Fasthouse

Category.Title: Locals
Category.Content:
We are Fasthouse, we represent a lifestyle that is dynamic, energized and full of passion for motorcycles and motorcycle racing – be it motocross, flat track, racing across the desert or simply taking a quick run up Mulholland on a weekend.  We want to introduce you to some of our moto family and friends and invite you to live the life we love.

{{FeaturedArticles}}

More to come!

Title: Jimmy Roberts
Content:
Jimmy Roberts has an exceptional pedigree. His dad is J.N. Roberts, a badass stuntman and a legendary desert race. Jimmy is following in his dad’s footsteps. He has worked on many of the biggest films in Hollywood, from doing seriously gnarly bike gags to stunt doubling for stars like Tom Cruise and Owen Wilson. But, like dad, it’s his passion for motorcycles and good dirt that dominates his life. He lives the life we love in northern LA County.


Q&A

Name
Jimmy N. Roberts III
Nickname
Rafe
Why do you ride?
Because I love it!!! And it keeps me sane. I enjoy working on my 20+ motorcycles and riding them as well. It's the whole package, the prep, the riding, and the cleaning. It's total freedom and now I'm getting to enjoy it with my daughter Jameson(8) and my son Rowan(5). A whole new generation and a whole bunch more work. But worth it so much. Plus I learn new things all time, the only downside is my knees are sore a lot. Small trade for all the enjoyment I get..
Where do you ride?
Let see I'm kinda a north LA county guy. So I when I ride moto it's at AV Motoplex, Gormon, Piru, Cal-City MX and sometimes Zaca. I ride off-road a lot too, and that be at Rowher Flats because I can ride there from my house. Also Dove Springs, Cal-City. I also do track days at Willow springs and SuperMoto at La Garange.
When you're not riding, you are...
Camp leader of the Roberts Clan. Having young kids keep me and my wife Tina very busy. Between homework, martial arts, riding, school activities, birthday parties, etc etc. I only work about six month's a year, which is great because I get to be a hands on dad. That's the best part of doing what I do.
What do you do for a living?
Grizzly, cantankerous, veteran 24 year stunt performer.
Who are your heroes?
My pops JN Roberts who walk away from racing on top and never look back. Still rides motocross at 72 years old and gets excited like a little kid about it. Doug Henry...
Motorcycle
Any Honda!!!!
Track
Zaca Station MX
Races
Day in the Dirt
Moto Memory
Seeing my dad from the freeway leading the Barstow to Vegas when I was 5 years old.
Movie
Forest Gump
Stunt
For me it would be doing a 85 ft high fall into boxes with fellow moto geek Gaston Howard for the movie " I Spy ".
MetaDescription: Meet Hollywood stuntman and motorcycle racer, Jimmy Roberts.
MetaKeyword: Jimmy Roberts, stuntman, Stunts Unlimited, Fasthouse, motorcycle racer, Day in the Dirt, J.N. Roberts, JN Roberts

Category.Content:
We are Fasthouse, we represent a lifestyle that is dynamic, energized and full of passion for motorcycles and motorcycle racing – be it motocross, flat track, racing across the desert or simply taking a quick run up Mulholland on a weekend.  We want to introduce you to some of our moto family and friends and invite you to live the life we love.

{{FeaturedArticles}}

More to come!

Title: Louie Franco
Content:
Motorcycle racer / stuntman Louie Franco only knows one way to do it, and that’s wide open, whether it’s in Baja or at a local grand prix. It all began for him back in the late 70’s and early 80’s at the legendary moto park, Indian Dunes, our old stomping ground. It became his way of life too.


Q&A

Name
Louie Franco
Nickname
Luscious Louie
Why do you ride?
Genetic defect from birth...but it's in my blood and I still love riding and racing motorcycles anywhere, anytime!
Where do you ride?
My Favorite place to ride motorcycles is Down in Baja, Mexico... Desert, Mountains, Beach, all within a couple of hours of riding. And it's 100% legal everywhere. It's the last real frontier and it's heaven on a bbike.
When you're not riding, you are...
Hanging out spending quality time with my family and friends, enjoying the great outdoors, our California beaches, ...surf, desert and mountains.
What do you do for a living?
Professional stuntman, businessman and entrepreneur.
Who are your heroes?
God, our U.S. Military and Evil Knievel
Motorcycle
Honda CRF450
Track
Indian Dunes
Races
Baja 1000
Moto Memory
Winning 8 consecutive Baja 1000's
Movie
The Great Escape
Stunt
J.N Roberts motorcycle work in the 70's, Robbie Madison in the 2000's

Category.Title: Locals
Category.Content:
We are Fasthouse, we represent a lifestyle that is dynamic, energized and full of passion for motorcycles and motorcycle racing – be it motocross, flat track, racing across the desert or simply taking a quick run up Mulholland on a weekend.  We want to introduce you to some of our moto family and friends and invite you to live the life we love.

{{FeaturedArticles}}

More to come!

Title: Will Harper
Content:
If you were alive in the early 70s, lived in So Cal and raced motocross you knew who Will Harper was. Super fast, strong, talented, and a winner. And he was one badass stuntman too. But his life got off the track for a while which he talks about in his book called “His Poetry.” Back on course now, you can find him almost every Saturday at Glen Helen racing REM. We’re proud to have Will as part of our moto crew.


Q&A

Name
Will Harper
Nickname
Will
Why do you ride?
I love the competition and the people involved with Motocross!
Where do you ride?
Mostly Glen Helen with a little Milestone, AV and Piru...
When you're not riding, you are...
Spreading the Good News of Jesus Christ, riding mountain and road bicycles and surfing.
What do you do for a living?
Stuntman/ Stunt Rigger
Who are your heroes?
Jesus Christ
Motorcycle
Maico
Track
Indian Dunes
Races
Friday Nite Indian Dunes
Moto Memory
Hopetown Grand Prix
Movie
On Any Sunday
Stunt
Motorcycle cable off
MetaDescription: Meet Will Harper, stuntman and motorcycle racer. He's part of the Fasthouse crew.
MetaKeyword: Will Harper, stuntman, Christian, motorcycle racer, born again, Fasthouse, Brand X, Tom Harper, Day in the Dirt

Category.Title: Locals
Category.Content:
We are Fasthouse, we represent a lifestyle that is dynamic, energized and full of passion for motorcycles and motorcycle racing – be it motocross, flat track, racing across the desert or simply taking a quick run up Mulholland on a weekend.  We want to introduce you to some of our moto family and friends and invite you to live the life we love.

{{FeaturedArticles}}

More to come!

Title: Robbie Wageman
Content:
Robbie lives in our hometown, Newhall, CA. The Wageman moto family has made its mark here. Rob Dog, as his friends call him, is one of fastest young racers around. You can find him tearing up the local tracks around So Cal and competing in some of the biggest and coolest races in the U.S. He is one of our local boys.

Q&A

Name
RJ Wageman
Nickname
Lil Rusty
Why do you ride?
Motocross is my love, and it's my life. It puts a smile on my face every chance I get to go ride. It's a great way to get some exercise and stay in great shape to live a healthy life. Making memories that will last a lifetime, talking and laughing with your "moto" buddies. And of course that one feeling few people get to experience, WINNING!
Where do you ride?
Living in the hub of all motocross tracks, my options are endless throughout the week! Glen Helen, Competitive Edge, Cauhilla Creek, Pala, Milestone, Racetown395, Zaca Station, I5, Piru, Perris, and Lucas Oil Mx Park. I've also been to Loretta Lynn's, Freestone, Mammoth, Hangtown, and Ponca City.
When you're not riding, you are...
When I'm not riding, you will find me riding or racing my mountain bike! I'm in love with exercising and can't get enough cardio.
What do you do for a living?
My dad, Russ, owns a motorcycle service, repair, and accessories shop called Pit Pro. I help him out there 2-3 times a week to keep busy and also make a little lunch money.
Who are your heroes?
I look up to my dad, he's been there done that and knows what it takes to get the job done. I look up to all professional athletes, it takes a lot to get to the top level and I know it's not easy. I've been a Travis Pastrana fan for as long as I can remember. All around a bad dude!
Motorcycle
My Dirt Bike Magazine, Pit Pro powered Yamaha YZ 250f
Track
Zaca Station MX
Races
Loretta Lynn's amateur national in Hurricane Mills, Tennessee. If you want to get your name on the map, that's the place to get it done!
Moto Memory
Winning two motos at the World Mini Grand Prix. Placing 4th in one moto at Loretta Lynn's and finishing 4th overall.
Movie
Ride Along! With Kevin Hart and Ice Cube, they will rock your world, it's a must see.
Stunt
A super big, clean, fat whip! Nothing cooler looking, or better feeling on the bike when you throw her sideways.
MetaDescription: One of our hometown boys, Robbie Wageman.
MetaKeyword: Robbie Wageman, motorcycle racer, Fasthouse, SoCal, Newhall

Category.Title: Locals
Category.Content:
We are Fasthouse, we represent a lifestyle that is dynamic, energized and full of passion for motorcycles and motorcycle racing – be it motocross, flat track, racing across the desert or simply taking a quick run up Mulholland on a weekend.  We want to introduce you to some of our moto family and friends and invite you to live the life we love.

{{FeaturedArticles}}

More to come!

Title: Danny Wynands
Content:
Dan Wynands is a Hollywood stuntman, but you have probably seen his work in many of the big action packed blockbusters from a different perspective. He maneuvers his custom motorcycle mounted with cameras, filming all the carnage up close and personal, at great risk to life and limb. We dig that he is one of our crew.


Action Trax

Q&A

Name
Dan Wynands
Nickname
2Tall
Why do you ride?
I love the feeling of being fully focused and going fast ( in my mind ). There is no other sport or pastime that gives you that feeling in my opinion. No better way to have fun with your friends.
Where do you ride?
All over the country and the world for my business. Locally I like to ride the high deserts and mountains. Moto X at Gorman, LACR when it was around, Zaca station, Mammoth.
When you're not riding, you are...
Thinking about riding. I mountain bike, surf, golf and try to stay fit for myself and work. Love to go out to eat, have a cocktail and see movies.
What do you do for a living?
Professional stuntman. Owner and operator of Action Trax camera bikes.
Who are you heroes?
John Wayne, Steve McQueen, JN Roberts, Bud Ekins, Kenny Roberts and all Moto GP riders.
Motorcycle
Honda 450 CRF
Track
LACR
Races
All Moto GP's/ AMA Outdoors
Moto Memory
Riding the Ironmans' for Day in the Dirt
Movie
Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid
Stunt
Chariot Race in Ben Hur
MetaDescription: Founding memerb of Brand X, Hollywood stuntman, camera bike operator, and motorcycle racer.
MetaKeyword: stuntman, dan wynands, hollywood, Brand X, camera bikes, tracking vehicles

Category.Title: Locals
Category.Content:
We are Fasthouse, we represent a lifestyle that is dynamic, energized and full of passion for motorcycles and motorcycle racing – be it motocross, flat track, racing across the desert or simply taking a quick run up Mulholland on a weekend.  We want to introduce you to some of our moto family and friends and invite you to live the life we love.

{{FeaturedArticles}}

More to come!

Title: Greg Flanagan
Content:
Greg has been racing dirt bikes and having fun as long as we can remember. He’s one of the fastest vets around and he’s pretty good on a mountain bike. We’re proud to have him as part of our moto crew.


Q&A

Name
Greg Flanagan
Nickname
Flanaman, Flanny
Why do you ride?
I ride because there is simply nothing greater than being on 2 wheels! Throttle Therapy is the best cure for almost anything. And I suck at golf...
Where do you ride?
I ride at Glen Helen a lot. Racetown and Cahuilla Creek are really fun too! I also like to hop on my Harley and head up one of the local canyons.
When you're not riding, you are...
When I'm not riding I'm usually out riding one of my bicycles with my wife, Gina or trying my best to explain to her why my 1967 Lincoln Continental broke down again, just after I fixed the last problem it had.
What do you do for a living?
I promote both the PedalFest and the Over the Hump LA mountain bike race series. I also rent equipment, such as Scissor Lifts, to contractors and production companies. I have also been known to operate a forklift in a TV commercial or two.
Who are your heroes?
My mom is my hero! She battled breast cancer down to the very end. Jeff Ward and Ricky Johnson are my two favorite moto heroes. Also, anyone who lives life the way they want to and stands apart from the crowd will get my nod.
Motorcycle
My 1978 XR75 was the first bike I ever raced. My 2008 Honda CRF450 was the most recent one that I really loved
Track
Corona Raceway was my first race so I have so many memories from there. Glen Helen is currently my favorite.
Races
1986 San Diego SX. My first main event in the 125 class. The 2012 reunion race at ADITD was great because I had a 45 minute battle with Troy Lee and Ty Schwartz and I have been racing those guys for 30 years!
Moto Memory
1985 Golden State Series in Madera, CA. I had just turned pro. Lined up for the LCQ. They took 2 to the show. Johnny 'O lines up right next to me. I was awestruck. I didn't make it in!
Movie
Princess Bride, Swingers, the Big Lebowski, and the Bourne movies.
Stunt
The stunt that the Nitro Circus guys pulled off in Castaic where the trucks and bikes and buggies were all flying over and under each other is one of the coolest things I have ever seen!
MetaDescription: Meet Greg Flanagan. Motocross racer and mountain bike racing promoter.
MetaKeyword: Greg Flanagan, motocross, mountain bike racing, Day in the Dirt

Category.Title: Locals
Category.Content:
We are Fasthouse, we represent a lifestyle that is dynamic, energized and full of passion for motorcycles and motorcycle racing – be it motocross, flat track, racing across the desert or simply taking a quick run up Mulholland on a weekend.  We want to introduce you to some of our moto family and friends and invite you to live the life we love.

{{FeaturedArticles}}

More to come!

Title: Justin Hoeft
Content:
On most Thursdays at Glen Helen you’ll find #615 tearing it up. That would be Justin Hoeft putting in his time. He’s brought home some big titles like; Loretta’s Amateur National Championship in the 85cc Stock and Mod classes and the Mammoth Motocross Super Mini Championship. He rides for TLD. We’re looking forward to what comes next.


Q&A

Name
Justin Hoeft
Nickname
JBones
Why do you ride?
I ride because it's fun it's my passion I love to push myself and am determined to be a champion.
Where do you ride?
I ride everywhere, all SoCal tracks but I do a lot of riding
What do you do for a living?
Race a dirt bike.
Who are your heroes?
My cousin Damon and my dad
Motorcycle
Honda CRF250R
Track
Pala
Races
Mammoth
Moto Memory
Winning my first Loretta Lynn's title
Movie
The Outside
Stunt
No footer
MetaDescription: Meet Justin Hoeft. Motocross racer. Fast.
